meanings.definition: To provide or endow with a quality or attribute.
meanings.sent1: She will indue her painting with vibrant colors to make it more beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The teacher will indue the students with knowledge during the lesson.
meanings.sent3: The magician indue the hat with magical powers, making it float in the air.
meanings.sent4: The chef indue the dish with a burst of flavors that delighted the diners.
meanings.sent5: The sun indue the sky with a warm glow as it set in the evening.

meanings.definition: To invest or clothe with a garment or robe.
meanings.sent1: The princess will indue her royal robe with precious jewels for the ceremony.
meanings.sent2: He decided to indue himself with a warm coat before going out in the cold.
meanings.sent3: The superhero indue his cape with special powers to fight the villain.
meanings.sent4: The designer indue the dress with intricate lace patterns for the fashion show.
meanings.sent5: The actor indue the character's costume with authenticity, bringing it to life on stage.
